newsitem.title: USA: Frederick says completes private placements.
newsitem.headline: Frederick says completes private placements.

text.p: Frederick Brewing Co said Wednesday it had completed two private placements raising net proceeds of about $3.3 million.

On March 31, the company completed an offering of 1,848 shares of Series A cumulative convertible preferred stock for $500 a share. The stock is convertible into common stock at an average conversion price of $3.71955 per share, the company said.
The FBC also closed the sale of 2,525 shares of Series B convertible preferred stock to non-U.S. purchasers and 1,225 shares to U.S. purchasers on April 8.

The Series B convertible preferred stock is convertible into common stock at the lower $3.50 per share or 70 percent of the closing bid price of the common stock averaged over the five days prior to conversion.
The company said that with the completion of these offerings, alleged defaults described in the Forbearance Agreements were deemed to have been cured.
"We believe the cash flow problems we encountered as a result of the delayed completion of our new brewery and unanticipated cost overruns, are now behind us," said Kevin Brannon, CEO.
Frederick Brewing Co participates in the growing "craft" beer segment of the domestic beer market, producing 11 styles of beers.
